trans-unit.source: A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column objects that represent the columns in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection to programmatically manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column objects.
These objects represent the columns in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
You can add, remove, or insert columns in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property is set to `true,` the columns created by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control are not added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control does not store the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection in the view state.
To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column every time the page is refreshed.
Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control's state is reloaded and the control is rebuilt.
Otherwise, the changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection are not reflected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control when it is displayed.

Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Visible%2A> property to display or hide each column.
The order of the columns in the collection determines the order that the columns are displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
The following table lists the different column classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
Column Class
Description
A column that is bound to a field in a data source.
It displays each item in the field as text.
This is the default column type for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
A column that displays a command button for each item in the column.
This allows you to create a column of custom button controls, such as Add or Remove buttons.
A column that contains editing commands for each item in the column.
A column that displays each item in the column as a hyperlink.
The contents of the column can be bound to a field in a data source, or to static text.
A column that displays each item in the column according to a specified template.
This allows you to control the content of the column, for example to display images.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class is the base class for the column classes listed.
It is not used directly in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> class.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control that corresponds with this collection.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> that stores the collection of columns.

Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object to the end of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object to the end of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control does not store the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection in the view state.
To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column each time the page is refreshed.
Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control can reload its state and rebuild itself.
Otherwise, the changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection are not reflected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control when it is displayed.

Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Visible%2A> property to display or hide each column.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object to append to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.

Inserts a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.

Use this method to insert a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object at the specified index location in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control does not store the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection in the view state.
To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column each time the page is refreshed.
Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control can reload its state and rebuild itself.
Otherwise, the changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection are not reflected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control when it is displayed.

Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Visible%2A> property to display or hide each column.
The index location in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> at which to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column to insert in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.
column is `null`.
Removes all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column objects from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this method to remove all <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column objects from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRowCollection.Count%2A> property is automatically set to `0` after this method is used.

Copies the items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection to the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.

Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index.
The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>.
A zero-based <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.
The first position in the specified <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to receive the copied contents.
array is `null`.
Gets the number of columns in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this property to determine the number of columns in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.
The number of columns in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.

Returns a <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface that contains all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.

Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface that can be iterated through easily to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the initial position.

The <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method must be called after creating a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> object, or after using the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

A <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.

Returns the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.

Use this method to determine the index number of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
If the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object is not found, an index of `-1` is returned.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column to search for in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.
The index position of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.
The default value is `-1`, which indicates that the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived object is not found.
Gets a value that indicates whether the columns in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection can be modified.
This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection can be written to in all cases.
`false` in all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection is synchronized (thread safe).
This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> class and is overridden to always return `false`.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
`false` in all cases.

Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.

Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection at the specified index using array notation.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.
Use this method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control does not store the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection in the view state.
To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column every time the page is refreshed.
Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control can reload its state and rebuild itself.
Otherwise, the changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection are not reflected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control when it is displayed.

Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Visible%2A> property to display or hide each column.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column to remove from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref>.

Removes a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection at the specified index.
Use this method to remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn>-derived column object from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> collection at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control does not store the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection in the view state.
To add or remove a column dynamically, you must programmatically add or remove the column each time the page is refreshed.
Provide a `Page_Init` function that adds or removes the column before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control can reload its state and rebuild itself.
Otherwise, the changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection are not reflected in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control when it is displayed.

Although you can programmatically add columns to or remove columns from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Columns%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, it is easier to list the columns statically and then use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Visible%2A> property to display or hide each column.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>-derived column in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> to remove.
index is less than `0` or greater than .
Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> object.

For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is tracking its view-state changes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23IsTrackingViewState%2A> member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
`true` if a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the previously saved state.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved view state values for the control.
Returns an object containing state changes.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved view state values for the control.
Starts tracking state changes.
